page.title: 20Pyrford, Woking.
page.content: The south east section of the area is mainly residential with substantial detached houses in large gardens. Some of these have been demolished and the land used to build three or four smaller houses.The roads, many of them private, are quiet and tree-lined. This area is bordered by the railway line and golf course to the north and by Pyrford Common to the South. The common land is mainly open scrub containing a variety of shrubs and wild flowers. There are foot and bridle paths through the Common which are well used. The areas of scattered woodland contain both deciduous and coniferous trees. Pyrford has a Cricket Club, a Gymnastic Club to which children from the whole area come and a very popular annual Flower Show.
